DOC.brief_summary: The objective study evaluate impact physical activity obese nonobese prepubertal child : 1. biological stress response psychosocial stress test 2. snack feel hunger response psychosocial stress test 3. moderating factor attachment biological stress response snack Children investigate one study day 3.5 hour .
DOC.detailed_description: Hypotheses In study , 3 primary hypothesis test . 1 . Moderate physical activity 25 min child decrease cortisol level response Trier Social Stress Test TSST-C ( child ) . 2 . Moderate physical activity 25 min child decrease snack ( calorie consumption correct expenditure switch quality food intake ) response Trier Social Stress Test TSST-C ( child ) . 3 . A secure attachment moderate factor general increase cortisol snack response psychosocial stress test ( Trier Social Stress Test TSST-C ) . Secondary objective : 1 . To test impact physical activity stress response snack differs obese non-obese child 2 . To test impact physical activity cardiovascular stress reactivity ( blood pressure , heart rate ) perceive stress ( scale ) response Trier Social Stress Test TSST-C ? 3 . To test stress reactivity modulation physical activity different anxious impulsives/labile child 4 . To test serious life event parental worry parental educational style influence stress reactivity
DOC.criteria: 710 year old child Severe illness Medications interfering study
